intro: Dithyrea wislizeni var. palmeri, commonly known as the Palmer's dithyrea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. This variant is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and subtle morphological differences from the typical form of Dithyrea wislizeni.
